intro: Pachystemon, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. They produce yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which is characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Pachystemon species are often found in grassy or rocky habitats and are adapted to arid conditions.
